clinical_study.brief_title: Value of Additional Upfront Systematic Lung Ultrasound in the Workup of Patients With Unilateral Pleural Effusion
clinical_study.official_title: Value of Additional Upfront Systematic Lung Ultrasound in the Workup of Patients With Unilateral Pleural Effusion: A Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The value of lung ultrasound in the work up of pleural effusion (fluid in between the thin doublet layered film surrounding the lungs) is unknown. The researchers will perform a systematic lung ultrasound scan including a scan for extra thoracic metastasis (spread of cancer to other organs) in the lymphnodes of the neck and metastasis lever in 56 patients one-sided pleural effusion. The researchers will measure if the interventions change the diagnostic plan for the patient and leads to faster diagnostics of the underlying course.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of cases where systematic lung ultrasound (LUS) change the planned diagnostic process for patients with unilateral pleural effusion.
primary_outcome.description: Information found in electronic patient files. Comparison of diagnostics planned before systematic ultrasound and diagnostics planned after systematic ultrasound. Measured in proportion of included patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of ultrasonic findings with additional systematic LUS.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, within 30 minutes after the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Characteristics is recorded in the ultrasound protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of cases where findings of clinical importance on systematic LUS were not identified at the initial contrast-enhanced CT thorax or PET-CT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 within 30 minutes after the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: CT thorax and PET-CT (as assessed by radiologist or clinician at the initial planning of diagnostic work-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of cases where the change in the diagnostic process after LUS provide a diagnose
secondary_outcome.description: Information found in electronic patient files.

secondary_outcome.measure: The patient experienced pain during procedure score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 within 30 minutes after the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a VAS (Visual Analogue Scale) scale 0-10, 0 being no pain, 10 being the worse pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 within 30 minutes after the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a 3-point Likert scale , scale1-3, 1 being not time consuming at all, 3 being very time consuming

secondary_outcome.measure: The patients willingness to have the same examination again in the future if necessary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1within 30 minutes after the end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a 5-point Likert scale, scale 1-5, 1 being definitely willing to have the examination again, 5 being definitely not willing to have the examination again

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean extra time spend on systematic LUS compared to conventional US for guidance of thoracentesis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 within 30 minutes after the end of procedure

arm_group.description: Patients with unilateral pleural effusion of unknown course

intervention.description: Patients will undergo a systematic lung ultrasound including review of: Sonographic characteristic of effusion Parietal, diaphragmatic and visceral pleura Pleural nodules Lung parenchyma Extra pulmonary findings: Hepatic pathology, enlarged lymph nodes of the neck and a cardiac assessment.

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred to the Pleura Clinic (an outpatient clinic in the Department of Pulmonary Disease, Næstved Sygehus, on of two regional centers for work up of pulmonary malignancy ) from the general practitioner or from other hospital departments both Næstved Sygehus and other hospitals.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years.
- Unilateral pleural effusion of unknown course.
- Patients must be able to give informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bilateral pleural effusions.
- Known cause of pleural effusions.
- Life expectancy <3 months.
- Inability to understand written or spoken Danish.
